name: Hotel Indigo London Tower Hill

reviews.title: A good London hotel experience
reviews.text: We stayed one night last weekend and as it was my birthday and perhaps also because I'm a member of the loyalty club we got upgraded to a suite which was very nice and much appreciated, the room was modern and well furnished and decorated with a nice bathroom. The reception staff were very helpful and friendly and the breakfast was also good. The location is good for the Tower of London area and catching a river bus but not so good for the West End and a taxi back from a show was £23,albeit partially caused by night road closures and diversions. Despite being part of a big chain the hotel was more like the smaller independant hotels that we tend to stay in and prefer to the big chains.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So well worth a stay and we'll certainly consider other Hotel Indigo's in the future.
reviews.title: Cute hotel! Nice service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I vacationed in London for the first time, and stayed at this hotel for two nights, shortly after a five-night stay in London on the West End (with a break in the middle to visit Bath.) This gave us a chance to experience the East End as well as the West End, and a bit of a change of scenery. I liked that this hotel was located in Tower Hill, which made it easy to visit Tower Bridge, the Tower of London, and Old Spitalfields market. And we got a great look at the Gherkin!!
reviews.title: Clean, Fun, Give it a shot

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I regret not asking for a room view, however. From what I understand, views of Tower Bridge are available at this hotel, but I did not specify, and thus received an unremarkable view of the street, where scaffolding/construction was underway on the building across the street. (Not the hotel's fault, just what we ended up with.) They may or may not be able to accomodate, but it never hurts to request a view!
reviews.title: We will be staying again!

reviews.text: However, the decor in the room was fantastic, and made up for the lack of a view outside. The sleek black four-poster beds are hip and glamorous (and comfortable!), and the bold color scheme is tasteful and vibrant. The wall mural of St. Paul's was a nice touch. The decor is what first attracted me to this hotel, after a friend stayed here and recommended it to me. The room was also very spacious.
reviews.title: Quirky, fun and modern!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went here with my girlfriend in May for 7 nights. Our stay was excellent, especially after so-so hotel experiences on previous trips to London. The hotel staff were polite, helpful, and did everything to make sure that our stay was great. Checking in and out was fast and easy. The rooms were clean, modern, and in excellent condition. The hotel did a really good job making up the room everyday. The only minor complaint was that the internet connection left a lot to be desired, but the hotel did make efforts to improve the connection. This was a very minor issue for us. The location is excellent. A tube station is only about a 2 or so minute walk from the hotel. There are a number of bus lines by the tube station as well. The hotel is only a short walk to Tower of London. Brick Lane and the surrounding areas are also only about a 10-15 minute walk from Hotel Indigo. I would definitely stay at Hotel Indigo again.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay At Hotel Indigo

reviews.text: Had a great overnight stay - probably the nicest London hotel we've stayed in. Very nice, friendly staff and the room was spacious, comfortable and with pleasant contemporary decor. Our room, on the sixth floor had a great view of the city skyline and was really well equipped with ipod dock, Nespresso coffee machine, free wifi, quality toiletries, complementary newspaper, bathrobe + slippers - even an iron + ironing board!!! Really couldn't fault it, and all for the price of a budget hotel in London. We'll definitely be back!
reviews.title: Brilliant hotel - excellent value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel for a nice weekend away, as my partner had been working so hard, I thought he deserved a break in a nice hotel. The location is outstanding, 2 minutes walk across from Aldgate, 5 minutes down to Tower Hill/Gateway and 10 minutes to Tower Bridge.
reviews.title: WOW Hotel...Shame about the restaurant!
Outstanding stay
reviews.text: I had arranged to upgrade to an exec room with reception prior to the stay. We arrived at 1pm and were greeted by two lovely receptionists (June 8th), and we were informed that our room was ready, I had previously mentioned that we would be arriving early as we had afternoon tea at The Waldorf at 2pm, and would like to drop our bags off, it was really helpful that they had taken that into consideration.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: so off we went to our room, and up to the fourth floor - I couldn't help but giggle every time I went in the lift, as floor levels were spoken by a women in a cockney accent. This really is such a beautiful hotel, the detail is great, as is the artwork. The room was so gorgeous (408 I think), lovely wooden floor, wooden four poster bed (massive!) so much floor space too!. lovely robes and slippers, and a great complimentary mini bar.
reviews.title: Excellent choice of stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed in an Executive Club level room for 3 nights in July 2013. We chose this hotel as it was very close to the Underground at Aldgate, as well as within walking distance of Spitalfields/Shoreditch area.
reviews.title: Nice wee hotel

reviews.text: The hotel itself is down a quiet little street in the heart of a very business-oriented part of London. Not much night life about.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was fairly large with a lovely four poster bed and free mini bar (soft drinks/water only). The air conditioning was easy to use, and the bathroom quite modern but functional.
reviews.title: Perfect and Amazing value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were all pleasant and provided newspapers and wake up calls when requested.
reviews.title: Really looked after us
Birthday weekend
reviews.text: We stayed at this property with another couple for three nights. It was the end of a three week vacation and we definitely saved the best for last. Comfy beds, clean everything, comp mini bar, great bath products and plush towels. Close walk to Aldgate tube station and London Tower. We had an issue with shower drain, but it was fixed promptly. Reception staff very helpful and friendly. I booked this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and was so happy I did.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a must if you are travelling to London....perfectly placed and excellant quality! When we return to the Capital it will be here that we stay! Complimentary mini bar, free paper in the morning....excellant tea/coffee making facilities and then there is the bed! Awesome! And the bathroom....Awesome.......and im not usually easily impressed but this hotel made me very impressed! A+ all the way!
reviews.title: Excellant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is quite simply the best hotel I have stayed in for the money. I have stayed in an numerous 4* and 5* hotels in London that have varied in price from £100 to £500 a night.
reviews.title: The best all round hotel I have stayed at in London

reviews.text: The Hotel Indigo has excellent service, is very modern with a lovely room and fantastic bathroom.
reviews.title: Great place to decompress after being out all day

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall this is great value for money and if there is anything better in London I haven't found it yet, despite staying at more than 40 different hotels over the last 10 years for business and pleasure!
reviews.title: Top hotel choice

reviews.text: One of the nicer places I've ever stayed - rooms were big, we got "upgraded" to a handicapped room and it was very spacious, clean and comfortable. Like everyone said, the minibar was stocked each day, nice wooden floors, and close to the subway/DLR and Tower of London.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

aka: Hotel Indigo London Tower Hill England
description: Ideally located near Tower Bridge and the Tower of London, Hotel Indigo London Tower Hill is just a stone's throw away from all of London's transportation links and so eminently suitable to both leisure visitors and business travellers alike.
